pros: Family feel, Everyone pushes you to do your best.
cons: have to explain and breakdown a lot of the video production needs to faculty and staff because they do not understand.

review_title: Nepotism - Run! Worst place to work.
pros: There are no pros working at this university. Majority of everyone who works there is incompetent and can't work anywhere else. I would not give it even one star!
cons: I witness a female faculty member be verbally abused by the provost who is a man. This male has verbally abused other women in the past and still have a job. Many of the faculty is not credentialed to teach in the subject area which needs to be reported to Southern Association of Colleges and Schools Commission on Colleges (SACSCOC). Many of the students who graduate can not even write a sentence due to being instructed by incompetent faculty members. Some of the staff/faculty have criminal records. There are many issues with this institution and the doors should of been shut years ago. This place is an unethical place to work. Run!

pros: - A great place to build marketable experiences - Able to meet great coworkers and students - Able to work reasonable hours
cons: - High employee and leadership turnover

pros: Family-like and friendly environment plus offer housing
cons: always doing overtime including weekends

pros: Overall goal of positive student experience.
cons: Culture amongst employees was toxic.

pros: You are making a genuine difference in students' lives. You are able to really get to know your students and see them grow.
cons:
Administration plays favorites rewarding incompetent people while letting go of (or pushing out) the people holding everything together. Decisions are not data-driven or carefully thought through.
Extremely stressful and toxic employment environment.
Faculty required to teach 15 hours per semester (no TA or GA) and still expected to advise, serve on committees, and research.

pros: I received the experience needed for my career growth.
cons: This Institution is unprofessional, unorganized, there's no accountability, and people do what they want to do... such as do not go to work or do their job.

review_title: Stay FAR AWAY FROM THIS PLACE!
pros: The students that come to class and want to be there are wonderful!
cons:
There are so many:
1. Moldy and dilapidated Buildings
2. Faculty Bullying from Administration (specifically Dean Wanda Coneal, stay out of her way!)
3. Roach infested buildings and bathrooms
4. Lack of Support for Junior Faculty
5. Mismanagement of Funds
6. Not a supportive environment

For the brief time that I was there, we were furloughed twice which means that we received little to no notice regarding pay or benefits.
It is literally the den of despair. They've had so many awesome and dynamic young faculty members who have come and left which speaks to a larger issue.

pros: HBCU experience like no other.
cons: Lack of resources in certain areas.

pros: The opportunity to work with students who will be greatly impacted with your interaction with them is extremely rewarding. Faculty enjoy a generous degree of autonomy with regard to their schedules. Additionally, full time university employees are paid on a bi-monthly schedule.
cons:
Under the previous administration: 
-A blatant lack of respect for the faculty's time. Faculty meetings often involve presentations from a member of the Executive Management team that could have easily been synthesized into an e-mail. 

-Faculty and staff were treated as disposable pawns and were often instructed not to have a substantive opinion regarding any policy related decision was to be made. This speak's to the previous administration's degree of value that it placed on it's faculty. 

-Low faculty moral due to perceived mismanagement and misguided decision making by the administration, as well as the lack of an ability to voice their opinion. 


The New Administration:
Too soon to tell...

review_title: Run Away! Don't Ever Consider Working Here, Please.
pros: The students were awesome and faculty don't pay for parking,
cons:
This is a terrible place to work! The faculty and staff are treated irresponsibly. Everything said in the news is absolutely true. People are threatened by those with advanced degrees and faculty are held responsible for students in a way that doesn't make them accountable. 

They aren't aware of what's going on in the real world and want to control every part of faculty and staff member lives. They've lost some great people in the time that I worked there and they'll continue to lose more because they have no idea how to work with people. Instead, they want to manage people. 

To make matters worse, faculty and staff were furloughed when I was there and are apparently furloughed again.  I doubt that this school will be open in the next 3 years.

pros: My co-workers will assist you in any possible. They will give you honest feed back to a situation
cons: If you are not under a contract no guarantee that you will teach a certain number of classes. Which means your money will not be the same each semester. Also you are only paid twice a semester.

review_title: Clean House To Save This HBCU
